data.name: CommonDataObj_BestCase_1
data.value: Your installation is controlled according to the smart [CompanyName] algorithm.

data.name: CommonDataObj_BestCase_2
data.value: Your average monthly peak would now be [Value] kW.

data.name: CommonDataObj_BestCase_3
data.value: This means a capacity rate for the simulation period of €[Price1]/month. That is an {b}additional saving of €[Price2]/month{/b} over the simulation period of one month thanks to the clever [CompanyName] algorithm. So extra on top of the 'normal' savings that you still achieve with your [BatteryName] home battery by increasing your grid independence.

data.name: CommonDataObj_RefCase_1
data.value: Your home battery runs on the standard algorithm of self-consumption optimization. This does not alter the fact that peak shaving is already being done here and there. The moment you produce solar panels, the consumers in your house are covered. Only when more power is required than production is energy from the grid and a peak can occur. If necessary, your home battery will intervene first at those times.

data.name: CommonDataObj_RefCase_2
data.value: Your highest average monthly peak was [Value] kW, and occurred on [Date] between [Time1] and [Time2].

data.name: CommonDataObj_RefCase_3
data.value: This means a capacity rate for the simulation period of €[Value]/month.
